content:
• Wednesday, October 3, 2012
  • TSLA

    Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) will make an advance payment on the DOE loan principal payment that's due in...

    Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) will make an advance payment on the DOE loan principal payment that's due in March, says CEO Elon Musk in a blog post. Musk's remarks come shortly after Tesla disclosed the politically pressured DOE wants the company to repay its loan at an accelerated pace. Also: Musk claims Tesla is "on the verge of becoming cash flow positive," and defends the company's Q3/Q4 guidance cut by claiming Tesla is "at the steepest portion of our production ramp."Â  Shares +1.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:11 PM | 3 Comments
  • SBAC

    U.S. cell tower owners rallied today, possibly in response to the MetroPCS/T-Mobile deal. SBAC...

    U.S. cell tower owners rallied today, possibly in response to the MetroPCS/T-Mobile deal. SBAC +2%. AMT +1.4%. CCI +2.8%. While the reverse merger will result in some duplicate cell sites being eliminated - American Tower just announced MetroPCS and T-Mobile share space on ~1,000 of its sites - it also puts T-Mobile's 4G LTE ambitions on better footing, both by increasing its spectrum assets and allowing the carrier to tap U.S. capital markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:49 PM
  • MAR

    More on Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): Q3 easily beats on strength in its North American...

    More on Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): Q3 easily beats on strength in its North American hotels, and better daily rates. The company narrowed its FY outlook range however, now seeing $1.68 to $1.72 per share, compared with previous guidance of $1.65 to $1.75. For Q4, earnings are expected to be $0.52 to $0.56 per share, the consensus estimate of $0.57. Shares +1.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:43 PM
  • MMM

    3M (NYSE:MMM) has terminated its deal to purchase Avery Dennison's (NYSE:AVY) Office and...

    3M (NYSE:MMM) has terminated its deal to purchase Avery Dennison's (NYSE:AVY) Office and Consumer Products business. Commenting on the news, Jesse Singh, MMM's VP and GM of Stationery and Office Supplies says “While we are disappointed with this turn of events, we remain focused, as always, on investing in product innovation and providing our customers with a broad range of premier products.” AVY -3.3%, MMM -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • BWP

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) -4.4% AH after announcing plans to offer 10M common units...

    Boardwalk Pipeline Partners (NYSE:BWP) -4.4% AH after announcing plans to offer 10M common units representing limited partner interests in a registered offering. BWP expects to use the net proceeds to repay borrowings or for other general partnership purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • MAR

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): FQ3 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2.7B beats by...

    Marriott International (NYSE:MAR): FQ3 EPS of $0.44 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $2.7B beats by $50M. Shares +2.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • LXK

    Lexmark (LXK -3.1%) and Xerox (XRX -2.5%) are two more casualties of H-P's depressing analyst...

    Lexmark (LXK -3.1%) and Xerox (XRX -2.5%) are two more casualties of H-P's depressing analyst day (I, II). H-P (HPQ -12.7%) predicted its Imaging & Printing Group's EPS contribution would grow by $0.05-$0.08 in FY13, but that's largely because the division's profits have plunged this year: for the first 9 months of FY12, IPG has seen its operating profit fall 20% Y/Y to $2.52B. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM | 5 Comments
  • MUR

    Murphy Oil (MUR +4.3%) shares spike following a CNBC report that Dan Loeb's Third Point hedge...

    Murphy Oil (MUR +4.3%) shares spike following a CNBC report that Dan Loeb's Third Point hedge fund may take an activist role in the company and has now accumulated a stake of at least 5%. CNBC says Loeb wants MUR to spin off its retail business, sell its Canadian assets, sell its 5% stake in Syncrude and complete its U.K. refinery business exit. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM
  • AMRX

    The FDA has withdrawn approval of Impax (IPXL -1%) and Teva's (TEVA -0.5%) Budeprion XL 300 mg,...

    The FDA has withdrawn approval of Impax (IPXL -1%) and Teva's (TEVA -0.5%) Budeprion XL 300 mg, saying it's reviewed new data that indicates it's not therapeutically equivalent to Wellbutrin XL 300 mg. Both companies have stopped shipping the product and are issuing detailed information to their customers. The FDA added that its announcement does not affect the Impax/Teva Budeprion 150 mg product or generic Budeprion products made by other manufacturers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • EGC

    Energy XXI (EXXI -5.2%) is downgraded to Neutral with a $40 target, down from $47, at Global...

    Energy XXI (EXXI -5.2%) is downgraded to Neutral with a $40 target, down from $47, at Global Hunter, which says it has become more cautious until it sees proof that production can indeed ramp at the clip management projects. Also, the firm initiates Natural Resource (NRP +4%) at Accumulate, believing it will continue to grow its asset base and royalty payments over the next three to five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:34 PM
  • ADY

    Feihe International (ADY +8%) jets higher after the company receives a $7.40-a-share going...

    Feihe International (ADY +8%) jets higher after the company receives a $7.40-a-share going private offer from CEO You-Bin Leng in tandem with a Morgan Stanley affiliate. The investors propose buying the company through an acquisition vehicle to be financed from cash and debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • DO

    Offshore drilling is in a "very, very strong” position thanks to global rig demand and the...

    Offshore drilling is in a "very, very strong” position thanks to global rig demand and the booming oil and gas E&P business, Diamond Offshore (DO -1.9%) chairman James Tisch tells CNBC. Dayrates for sixth-generation rigs have risen from $400K/day a few years ago to $550K-$600K now, he says; natural gas is “transformative for our economy."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM | 6 Comments
  • GST

    Shares of Gastar Exploration (GST -25.1%) are reeling after Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) files a...

    Shares of Gastar Exploration (GST -25.1%) are reeling after Chesapeake (NYSE:CHK) files a lawsuit seeking rescission of certain transactions that closed in 2005 involving GST's Hilltop Prospect in Texas and CHK's investment in GST common stock. In addition to its original initial investment of $81.6M, CHK seeks reimbursement of additional lease and well costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM | 9 Comments
  • PSSI

    Medical distributor PSS World Medical (PSSI -1%) dips after short-selling blog...

    Medical distributor PSS World Medical (PSSI -1%) dips after short-selling blog TheStreetSweeper.com quoted an unnamed doctor as saying that the company's plan to reinvent itself is an "act of pure desperation," adding that the company is loaded with debt and Wall Street analysts "seem a bit skeptical" about the plan. Additionally, forensic accountant Keith Mautner, recently reviewed its financial documents and noted some discrepancies, saying "It wouldn't surprise me if the company was trying to hide something."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • S

    The Street's newfound skepticism about the likelihood of an expensive Sprint/Leap Wireless deal...

    The Street's newfound skepticism about the likelihood of an expensive Sprint/Leap Wireless deal may not be good news for Leap's shares, but it clearly is for Sprint's (S +6.9%): the #3 U.S. carrier has erased the losses it saw yesterday after reports of a pending MetroPCS/T-Mobile deal (confirmed today) raised fears debt-laden Sprint would pay through the nose to buy Leap. 4G partner Clearwire (CLWR -0.4%) has largely tread water over the last 2 days, in spite of yesterday's volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 4 Comments
  • CIG

    Brazilian utility stocks come under pressure following a local report that companies failing to...

    Brazilian utility stocks come under pressure following a local report that companies failing to renew expiring contracts, which carry stricter government rules aimed at cutting costs, will be barred from participating in future auctions for licenses. Decliners include Cemig (CIG -4%), which also is downgraded by Barclays; ELP -1.1%, EBR -2.9%, ENI -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM
  • KRA

    Kraton Polymers (KRA -11.6%) is downgraded to Neutral by Macquarie, which cites a choppy product...

    Kraton Polymers (KRA -11.6%) is downgraded to Neutral by Macquarie, which cites a choppy product demand setting and a near-term stalling of per-unit profits. The firm says estimates are missing the volume collapse that tends to accompany a 40% Q/Q decline in prices for butadiene, KRA's principal raw material, as product buyers await lower prices.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:10 PM
  • ADTN

    Adtran (ADTN -6.1%) plummets in afternoon trading after warning seasonality and weak telecom...

    Adtran (ADTN -6.1%) plummets in afternoon trading after warning seasonality and weak telecom equipment capex "may lead to a 'teens' percentage point sequential decrease" in Q4 revenue. Adtran tumbled last week after warning it expects Q3 revenue of $162M - though the current Q4 revenue consensus of $177.6M is likely outdated, investors clearly weren't counting on a drop below $150M. Rival Calix (CALX -1.7%) is also lower.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM
  • OCN

    "This is not particularly good news for Nationstar," says Wilbur Ross, talking his book after...

    "This is not particularly good news for Nationstar," says Wilbur Ross, talking his book after selling Homeward Residential to Ocwen (OCN +16%). "This is very much a scale business," he says, so those gathering assets the fastest should do best. Left unsaid is the deal likely leaves Nationstar as the winner for the Rescap servicing assets. After a brief dip, NSM +3.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:20 PM
  • DIN

    Shares of DineEquity (DIN +4%) post a gain after the company lands an upgrade to Buy from...

    Shares of DineEquity (DIN +4%) post a gain after the company lands an upgrade to Buy from Neutral. Channel checks for Applebee's and International House of Pancakse are positive, according to the firm.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • BIOL

    Biolase (BIOL +36%) shares are soaring after the company received 510(k) clearance from the FDA...

    Biolase (BIOL +36%) shares are soaring after the company received 510(k) clearance from the FDA for its EPIC 10 diode soft tissue laser, and began immediately offering the device for sale in the U.S. The company also received CE Mark approval for the laser in the European Union and began commercial sales there, as well as in Asian and Latin American countries that also recognize the CE Mark, during the final few days of its Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG +33%) skyrockets after the judge overseeing the company's legal battle with Google...

    Vringo (VRNG +33%) skyrockets after the judge overseeing the company's legal battle with Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) denies Google's request for a summary judgment, and orders the companies to engage in settlement talks on Oct. 9. Barring a settlement, a trial is set to begin on Oct. 16. Many SA writers have been discussing Vringo/Google in recent weeks.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM | 8 Comments
  • DELL-OLD

    Dell (DELL-OLD -1.7%) and AMD (AMD -3.1%) slump as investors mull the implications of H-P's...

    Dell (DELL-OLD -1.7%) and AMD (AMD -3.1%) slump as investors mull the implications of H-P's analyst day commentary and guidance. The companies, who have been hit hard by worries about tepid PC demand, are both making new multi-year lows.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • SRPT

    Midday top 10 gainers: SRPT +162%. BIOL +38%. VRNG +25%. OCN +16%. KFS +16%. ASPS +14%. SNFCA...

    Midday top 10 gainers: SRPT +162%. BIOL +38%. VRNG +25%. OCN +16%. KFS +16%. ASPS +14%. SNFCA +12%. TRU-OLD +10%. HOV +10%. ICAD +10%.
    Top 10 Losers: GST -21%. LEAP -16%. XRTX -15%. THTI -13%. PBM -12%. SSY -10%. HOLL -10%. KRA -10%. ATRS -9%. KIOR -9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM | 2 Comments
  • HPQ

    More from H-P's (HPQ -7.5%) analyst day: H-P establishes FY13 EPS guidance of $3.40-$3.60, below...

    More from H-P's (HPQ -7.5%) analyst day: H-P establishes FY13 EPS guidance of $3.40-$3.60, below a consensus of $4.18. Enterprise Services will see a $0.29-$0.35 EPS drop thanks to an 11%-13% revenue decline, and enterprise hardware a $0.05-$0.12 drop. Software and printing earnings are expected to grow, and PC earnings are seen as flat to slightly down. Meg Whitman admits there have been execution issues. The Street isn't happy. (live blog, webcast)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • PVAC

    Penn Virginia (PVA -2.3%) ropes in another 30 potential well locations after increasing its...

    Penn Virginia (PVA -2.3%) ropes in another 30 potential well locations after increasing its acreage position in the Eagle Ford shale, acquiring 4,100 net acres across Gonzales and Lavaca counties in Texas for ~$10M.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:25 PM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +8.2%) has steadily moved higher today after having slumped in recent weeks....

    Acme Packet (APKT +8.2%) has steadily moved higher today after having slumped in recent weeks. The heavily-shorted VoIP infrastructure provider has occasionally been the subject of M&A speculation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:20 PM
  • CNQ

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -2.5%) enters a gas processing agreement with the Canadian unit...

    Canadian Natural Resources (CNQ -2.5%) enters a gas processing agreement with the Canadian unit of Williams Cos. (WMB -1.8%), where WMB will invest C$500M-C$600M to help lower CO2 emissions at CNQ's Horizon oil sands project, and CNQ will receive methane in return, which will be used as fuel for Horizon.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • HPQ

    H-P (HPQ -5.4%) dives as its analyst day gets underway (live blog, webcast). Meg Whitman has...

    H-P (HPQ -5.4%) dives as its analyst day gets underway (live blog, webcast). Meg Whitman has declared FY13 to be a "fix and rebuild" year that will see a broad-based profit decline (centered around enterprise services), and has again made cautious remarks about European and Chinese demand (previous). Analysts currently expect H-P's FY13 EPS to rise slightly. Streamlining H-P's product line is named a priority: the company plans to halve its printer SKUs next year.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 11 Comments
  • UEC

    Uranium Energy (UEC +2.6%) announces initial drill results from its Burke Hollow Project in...

    Uranium Energy (UEC +2.6%) announces initial drill results from its Burke Hollow Project in south Texas, where a total of 224 exploration holes have been drilled to date. Five uranium trends have been identified and are under delineation, and plans are underway for an initial independent qualified resource estimate.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:55 AM
  • SPXC

    India's Paharpur Cooling Towers Ltd. reportedly is in talks to acquire the cooling business of...

    India's Paharpur Cooling Towers Ltd. reportedly is in talks to acquire the cooling business of SPX Corp. (SPW +5.7%) for $500M-$600M, and the Indian company’s management is exploring ways to tie up the financing of the deal with several foreign banks  SPX declines to comment.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:47 AM
  • NTAP

    NetApp (NTAP -2.3%) slides in response to OEM partner Xyratex's (XRTX -15.7%) poor results and...

    NetApp (NTAP -2.3%) slides in response to OEM partner Xyratex's (XRTX -15.7%) poor results and guidance. Xyratex's earnings call remarks about its Enterprise Data Storage unit seeing "a material decrease" in demand also aren't helping. But BMO and Cantor are defending NetApp: BMO claims NetApp is seeing a mix shift towards low-end solutions that aren't supported by Xyratex, while Cantor argues channel checks and contract manufacturer Jabil's guidance bode well for NetApp.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • T

    After soaring yesterday on MetroPCS/T-Mobile reports, and rising more in premarket trading after...

    After soaring yesterday on MetroPCS/T-Mobile reports, and rising more in premarket trading after the deal was announced, Leap Wireless (LEAP -15.4%) is more than giving back its gains, as investors conclude the deal's terms might not bode well for Leap. A downgrade to Neutral from JPMorgan also isn't helping: the firm doubts a suitor will arrive in the near-term, and calls Leap an "unattractive" target for Sprint (S +0.2%). MetroPCS (PCS -8.5%), meanwhile, has seen its losses steepen.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • DISH

    Shares of Dish Network (DISH +3.3%) break higher with Chairman Charlie Ergen slated to speak at...

    Shares of Dish Network (DISH +3.3%) break higher with Chairman Charlie Ergen slated to speak at a wireless infrastructire show later today. The buzz is that the exec could drop some enticing hints on its spectrum plans at the affair. The MetroPCS/T-Mobile merger is also a meaningful backdrop for traders.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • BCOV

    Brightcove (BCOV +3.9%) trades higher after announcing Discovery Networks will use the...

    Brightcove (BCOV +3.9%) trades higher after announcing Discovery Networks will use the Brightcove App Cloud mobile app development/hosting platform to provide interactive, dual-screen, TV services. Brightcove appears to be finally breaking out of a trading range it has been stuck in since mid-August.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM
  • MOS

    Lazard Capital downgrades Mosaic (MOS -1.3%) and Potash (POT -2%) to Neutral from Buy, warning...

    Lazard Capital downgrades Mosaic (MOS -1.3%) and Potash (POT -2%) to Neutral from Buy, warning investors not to consider yesterday's dip in MOS a buying opportunity. The firm expects potash prices to drift lower despite strong crop fundamentals which will support fertilizer demand, and doesn't see any catalyst that would lead to meaningful stock price gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM
  • KHC

    A sharp spike in shares of Kraft Foods Group (KRFT) is being attibuted to a mini-flash crash....

    A sharp spike in shares of Kraft Foods Group (KRFT) is being attibuted to a mini-flash crash. CNBC is reporting that trades at or above $47.82 are in the process of being canceled. (chart breakdown)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • LOCK

    LifeLock (NYSE:LOCK) fails to secure an identity as a successful IPO. After pricing its...

    LifeLock (NYSE:LOCK) fails to secure an identity as a successful IPO. After pricing its 15.7M-share offering at $9 (below a prior range of $9.50-$11.50), the ID theft protection services firm opened at $8.38 and is currently moving at $8.72, down 3.1%. That's good for a market cap of $727M. LifeLock posted 1H revenue of $125.5M (+38% Y/Y) and net income of $1.2M.(previous) (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM

  • After a brief pop higher on EIA data showing an unexpected draw in oil stocks, WTI crude resumes...

    After a brief pop higher on EIA data showing an unexpected draw in oil stocks, WTI crude resumes its sharp decline, -2.7% to $89.38/barrel. What inflation worry? The price of crude has now fallen by about $10 since the Fed's QE∞ announcement on September 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM | 5 Comments
  • AOBC

    Shares of gun makers Smith & Wesson (SWHC -4.2%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR -2.8%) fall today on...

    Shares of gun makers Smith & Wesson (SWHC -4.2%) and Sturm, Ruger (RGR -2.8%) fall today on the back of cautious comments out of Benchmark. Analyst Mike Greene suggests that the growth in applications for handguns slowed last month to just 14.7%, down from the 20%-plus growth levels seen from May-August.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:47 AM | 8 Comments
  • AAL

    Airline stocks post strong gains as oil prices swing lower with crude inventory data coming in...

    Airline stocks post strong gains as oil prices swing lower with crude inventory data coming in below expectations. Leading advancers: LCC +5.7%, UAL +3.6%, HA +4.0%, DAL +3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • SMTC

    Semtech (SMTC +3.4%) pops on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard, which is setting a $31 target. The...

    Semtech (SMTC +3.4%) pops on an upgrade to Buy from Lazard, which is setting a $31 target. The firm praises Semtech's recently-closed acquisition of Gennum, a Canadian analog/mixed-signal chipmaker focused on the optical communications and video broadcast markets, as well as the company's emerging markets growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • ARUN

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +5.6%) is rebounding after falling 8.9% yesterday on news it would delay...

    Aruba Networks (ARUN +5.6%) is rebounding after falling 8.9% yesterday on news it would delay filing its 10-K. Yesterday, Wells Fargo praised Aruba's technology lead in the (enterprise) Wi-Fi equipment market, and forecast the market would grow 15%-20% over the next few years, thanks to the "bring your own device" trend, corporate interest in "right-sizing" wireline networks, and demand for next-gen Wi-Fi solutions. 22.6% of Aruba's float was shorted as of Sep. 14.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • GILD

    Gilead (GILD +1.1%) trades up after UBS ups its price target and reiterates a Buy rating on the...

    Gilead (GILD +1.1%) trades up after UBS ups its price target and reiterates a Buy rating on the shares to reflect its heightened presence the Hepatitis C vaccine market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NFLX +6.5%) roars out of the gate with a solid gain as Citi backs the Buy-rated name on...

    Netflix (NFLX +6.5%) roars out of the gate with a solid gain as Citi backs the Buy-rated name on the strength of their survey that shows improving customer satisfaction for the first time since last year's "Apocaflix" PR disaster. The Citi take in a nutshell: NFLX can be bought by investors at 10X P/E as its U.S. operations generate $5.50 in EPS, with a free call option on the company's international business. (Also: Whitney Tilson pitches the bull case on NFLX)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM | 20 Comments
  • AEZS

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) -12% to $0.61 after saying that it's consolidating its shares on...

    Aeterna Zentaris (NASDAQ:AEZS) -12% to $0.61 after saying that it's consolidating its shares on a 6-1 basis as part of an attempt to regain compliance with Nasdaq's minimum bid-price requirement. Aeterna Zentaris expects that the post-consolidation stock will begin trading on Friday. The move will cut the number of outstanding common shares to 18.7M from 112.4M. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:58 AM | 3 Comments
  • RIGL

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RIGL) sinks 7.3% to $9.58 after pricing an offering of 13.685M...

    Rigel Pharmaceuticals (NASDAQ:RIGL) sinks 7.3% to $9.58 after pricing an offering of 13.685M shares at $9.50 each, resulting in gross proceeds of $130M. The underwriters have a 30-day option to buy up to 2.05M extra shares to cover overallotments. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • SSYS

    Stratasys (SSYS +5.8%) surges after Craig-Hallum upgrades shares to Buy and lifts its target to...

    Stratasys (SSYS +5.8%) surges after Craig-Hallum upgrades shares to Buy and lifts its target to $70 from $50. Rival 3D printer maker 3D Systems (DDD +2.2%) is also up.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM | 8 Comments
  • ATRS

    Antares Pharma (NASDAQ:ATRS) slumps 7.4% to $4.07 after pricing an offering of 12.5M shares at...

    Antares Pharma (NASDAQ:ATRS) slumps 7.4% to $4.07 after pricing an offering of 12.5M shares at $4 each, resulting in net proceeds of $47M. The underwriters have a 30-day option to buy up to 1.875M extra shares. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • TCPTF

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC -5.2%) says it is suspending stripping activity associated with the...

    Thompson Creek Metals (TC -5.2%) says it is suspending stripping activity associated with the next phase of production at the Thompson Creek Mine; TC expects to save ~$100M in operating costs and $8M-$9M in capital expenditures, as well as reduce the mine workforce by ~100 workers.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM | 4 Comments
  • PBTH

    Prolor Biotech (NYSEMKT:PBTH) +8.3% premarket after receiving a notice of allowance from the...

    Prolor Biotech (NYSEMKT:PBTH) +8.3% premarket after receiving a notice of allowance from the U.S. patent office for a new patent application covering its long-acting CTP-enhanced human growth hormone. The patent gives PBTH additional intellectual property protection covering methods for the induction of growth in growth hormone deficient patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • OCN

    Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) cuts a deal to buy Wilbur Ross' mortgage servicing and origination...

    Ocwen Financial (NYSE:OCN) cuts a deal to buy Wilbur Ross' mortgage servicing and origination firm, Homeward Residential Holdings, for $588M in cash and $162M in convertible preferred stock. Homeward has an unpaid portfolio balance (UPB) of more than $77B and a "growing" origination business of $10B annually. Shares +5.8% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • ROYL

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +9.6% premarket after announcing the resumption of drilling operations...

    Royale Energy (OTC:ROYL) +9.6% premarket after announcing the resumption of drilling operations at its Sacramento Basin natural gas field where it has drilled 20 producing wells. Following a 3D seismic survey earlier this year, ROYL says it identified up to 14 new prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:18 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures tick higher after the ADP jobs report pleasantly surprises,...

    Market preview: Stock futures tick higher after the ADP jobs report pleasantly surprises, although don't expect it to say much about what the non-farm data will be like on Friday. The S&P Benchmark is +0.1%. MetroPCS -0.5% following confirmation that it's merging with T-Mobile USA, while Best Buy is +3.4% on speculation that Richard Schulze and P-E firms are doing their due diligence. Later: ISM Non-Manufacturing Index
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM | 2 Comments
  • DTEGY

    More on the MetroPCS/T-Mobile USA merger: MetroPCS shareholders will get $1.5B in cash and a 26%...

    More on the MetroPCS/T-Mobile USA merger: MetroPCS shareholders will get $1.5B in cash and a 26% stake in the combined company (MetroPCS closed with a $4.9B market cap yesterday), and Deutsche Telekom (OTCQX:DTEGY) the remaining 74% stake. The deal is expected to close in 1H13. The WSJ notes the deal's reverse-merger structure could allow DT to gradually sell its stake and exit the U.S. market. PCS -2.1% after yesterday's big gains. LEAP +3.4%. S -1.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 7 Comments
  • SRPT
